head.title: Competence - Datair: Artem Zaikin

list_2:
Define Objectives: Determine the purpose of the site (informational, commercial, portfolio, etc.).
 Target Audience Analysis: Understand the needs and expectations of users.
 Competitor Analysis: Review competitors and their sites.
 Create a Brief: A document outlining all requirements and wishes for the site.

Site Architecture: Plan the structure, navigation, and content (site map).
 Wireframing: Create basic page layouts to visualize the structure.
 Design: Develop the graphic design, including color schemes, fonts, images, and overall style.

Front-end Development: Code the design using HTML, CSS, JavaScript. Create the sit's interface.
 Back-end Development: Set up the server-side of the site, program logic, and integrate the database.
 Integration: Combine front-end and back-end parts, and integrate with external services.

Functional Testing: Check all site features against requirements.
 Cross-device Testing: Ensure proper display and functionality on different screen sizes and browsers.
 Bug Fixing: Address any bugs and issues found.

Deployment: Upload the site to the hosting server.
 Domain Setup: Link the domain to the hosting.
 Final Check: Perform a final review of all functions before the official launch.

Search Engine Optimization (SEO): Set up meta tags, keywords, URL structure, etc.
 Marketing: Launch advertising campaigns, promote on social media, content marketing.

Monitoring: Track site performance, user feedback, and errors.
 Updates: Add new content, fix issues, and update security.

blog.title: Find all the information you need

list.title: Industries
list.description: Find out what industries are covered by my solutions and how they can benefit from my expertise.

list.title: Business Digitalization
list.description: Business digitalization, or simply digitalization, refers to the process of integrating digital technologies and digitized data to transform how a business operates, interacts with customers, and even generates revenue.

list.title: Statement of Work (SOW)
list.description: SOW is a document that outlines the specific tasks, deliverables, and timeline for a project, typically used in the context of a client-vendor or contractor relationship.

body.title: Logistics and Supply Chain Management
body.text:
Logistics is a key part of supply chain management, focused on the efficient forward and reverse movement of goods, services, and related information from the point of origin to the point of consumption, in line with customer requirements. Logistics management is the glue that holds the supply chain together, overseeing resources that range from tangible goods such as materials, equipment, and supplies to food and other perishables.

Military logistics ensures the continuous supply of food, weaponry, ammunition, spare parts, and troop transport. Civil logistics involves the acquisition, movement, and storage of raw materials, semi-finished goods, and finished products. For sectors such as waste collection, postal services, utilities, and after-sales support, logistical challenges must be carefully managed.

body.title: E-commerce
body.text: E-commerce refers to the buying and selling of goods and services over the internet. It spans various models, from business-to-consumer (B2C) marketplaces to business-to-business (B2B) platforms. Successful e-commerce operations rely on secure payment systems, user-friendly interfaces, effective digital marketing, and streamlined logistics. As mobile shopping and social commerce grow, businesses increasingly focus on personalization, data analytics, and customer trust to stay competitive.

body.title: Healthcare
body.text: The healthcare industry encompasses services and systems aimed at maintaining and improving people's health. It includes hospitals, clinics, telemedicine, pharmaceuticals, and biotechnology. Modern healthcare relies on advanced technologies, skilled professionals, and effective supply chains for medicines and equipment. Preventive care, patient-centered approaches, and data-driven decision-making are critical to improving outcomes and ensuring accessibility.

body.title: E-grocery
body.text: E-grocery is the online retailing of fresh and packaged food products, often supported by rapid delivery services. This sector blends e-commerce convenience with the challenges of handling perishable goods, requiring robust cold-chain logistics and inventory management. Innovations such as subscription boxes, AI-powered shopping suggestions, and local sourcing are shaping the future of the e-grocery market.

body.title: Education
body.text: The education sector covers institutions, programs, and technologies designed to develop knowledge and skills. It ranges from early childhood education to higher learning and vocational training. Digital transformation has introduced e-learning platforms, hybrid classrooms, and AI-driven personalized learning paths. Lifelong learning and reskilling are increasingly essential in a fast-changing global economy.

body.title: Renewable Energy
body.text: The renewable energy industry focuses on generating power from sustainable sources such as solar, wind, hydro, and geothermal. It plays a critical role in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, increasing energy independence, and driving innovation in storage and smart grid technologies.

body.title: Tourism and Hospitality
body.text: This sector includes travel services, hotels, restaurants, and entertainment venues that cater to domestic and international visitors. It thrives on providing memorable experiences, embracing cultural diversity, and adapting to trends like eco-tourism and personalized travel planning.

body.title: Information Technology
body.text: The IT industry develops, manages, and supports software, hardware, and networking systems. It drives innovation across all sectors through cloud computing, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, and data analytics.

body.title: Fintech
body.text: The fintech industry merges finance and technology to deliver innovative financial services such as mobile banking, digital wallets, online lending, and blockchain-based transactions. Its growth is driven by user demand for faster, more accessible, and secure financial solutions.

body.title: Biotechnology
body.text: Biotechnology applies biological systems and living organisms to develop products and technologies for healthcare, agriculture, and environmental protection. This includes genetic engineering, biofuels, and advanced therapies such as CRISPR-based treatments.

body.title: Cybersecurity
body.text: Cybersecurity focuses on protecting networks, systems, and data from digital threats. As cyberattacks become more sophisticated, this industry plays a vital role in safeguarding critical infrastructure, businesses, and personal information.

body.title: Space Industry
body.text: The space industry involves the design, manufacture, and operation of spacecraft, satellites, and related infrastructure. It supports communication, navigation, climate monitoring, and exploration missions, with growing involvement from private companies.

body.title: Personal Solution
body.text: I approach every project individually: I analyze business processes, identify weak points, and build a strategy for digital transformation. To achieve this, I combine web and mobile technologies, automate workflows, optimize services, and implement management tools. My goal is not just to deliver a single product but to create a complete ecosystem that saves resources, works efficiently, and helps a business stay competitive.

body.title: Web Development
body.text: I build modern web solutions ranging from corporate portals and CRM systems to e-commerce platforms and complex web applications. For me, a website is not just a digital presence — it’s a tool for attracting clients and growing a business. I focus on speed, security, and usability, while also making sure the design is responsive and visually appealing.

body.title: Mobile Development
body.text: I develop mobile applications that help businesses connect with their clients more effectively. These can be simple service apps or large platforms with advanced functionality. I work on thoughtful UX/UI design, seamless integration with other services, high performance, and scalability so that the app is not only functional but also enjoyable to use.

body.title: Systems and Services
body.text: I design and implement systems and services that make business operations easier and more efficient. This can include process automation, cloud platform integration, microservice architecture, or APIs to connect different systems. My goal is to make technology practical and useful, so that it truly supports business growth and efficiency.

body.title: What is a Statement of Work (SOW)
body.text: A Statement of Work is a formal document that clearly describes what will be delivered within a project, what goals are set, what tasks will be solved, and what outcomes are expected. It serves as the foundation of collaboration between a client and a contractor. A well-written SOW helps avoid misunderstandings, fixes agreements in writing, and keeps the project under control at every stage.

body.title: Key Elements of a Good SOW
body.text:
A solid SOW always includes several essential sections:
1) Project goals — what problem needs to be solved and what results are expected.
2) Scope of work — the specific tasks to be completed.
3) Timeline — deadlines and milestones for the project.
4) Acceptance criteria — how to define whether the work is done correctly.
5) Budget — overall cost and possible expenses.
Covering these points ensures clarity and minimizes risks of misinterpretation or gaps in cooperation.

body.title: Common Mistakes in Writing SOWs
body.text: A frequent mistake is keeping the SOW too general and avoiding details. This often causes confusion, unexpected costs, and conflicts. Common issues include missing deadlines, unclear quality criteria, vague scope of work, or ignoring external dependencies (such as access rights or third-party services). Another mistake is failing to address risks, which can turn minor delays into serious problems. The more detailed the document, the less chance for conflicts.

body.title: Practical Tips for Clients
body.text:
To create a good SOW, clients should:
- Clearly define their business objectives.
- Set priorities: what is critical and what is optional.
- Put all agreements in writing, even if they seem obvious.
- Add examples or references to reduce the risk of misinterpretation.
- Before final approval, review the document from both perspectives: is it clear what, when, and at what cost will be done?
This approach saves time, money, and nerves, while making the project move faster and more predictably.
